article_title: Fidelity to pay $12 million to settle 401(k) suits
article_text:
Fidelity Investments has agreed to pay $12 million to settle two lawsuits brought by its own employees that alleged the mutual fund giant charged excessive fees in the company’s own 401(k) plans.

It admitted no wrongdoing in settling the cases, Bilewicz v. FMR LLC and Yeaw v. FMR LLC.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Nick Thornton
article_metadata.description: As part of the settlement, the firm's employees will be able to choose from an array of Fidelity and non-Fidelity mutual funds in its 401(k) menu.

It admitted no wrongdoing in settling the cases, Bilewicz v. FMR LLC and Yeaw v. FMR LLC.
Fidelity Investments has agreed to pay $12 million to settle two lawsuits brought by its own employees that alleged the mutual fund giant charged excessive fees in the company’s own 401(k) plans.
